item.title: Patrice add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "Ninety-eight percent of the adults in this country are decent, hard-working, honest Americans. It's the other lousy two percent that get all the publicity. But then--we elected them. " -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Shirley MacLaine
item.description: "The person who knows how to laugh at himself will never cease to be amused." -- Shirley MacLaine

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Dolly Parton
item.description: "People always ask me how long it takes to do my hair. I don’t know, I’m never there." -- Dolly Parton

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Laura Kightlinger
item.description: "I can’t think of anything worse after a night of drinking than waking up next to someone and not being able to remember their name, or how you met, or why they’re dead." -- Laura Kightlinger

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Phyllis Diller
item.description: "I want my children to have all the things I couldn’t afford. Then I want to move in with them." -- Phyllis Diller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope" -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "A vote is like a rifle: its usefulness depends upon the character of the user." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Everyone is in favor of free speech. Hardly a day passes without its being extolled, but some people's idea of it is that they are free to say what they like, but if anyone else says anything back, that is an outrage." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all -- the apathy of human beings." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The highest result of education is tolerance" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Phyllis Diller
item.description: "Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight." -- Phyllis Diller

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds the most discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but 'That's funny..." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Patrice add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is funny how mortals always picture us as putting things into their minds: in reality our best work is done by keeping things out." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description:
"CALVIN: Isn't it strange that evolution would give us a sense of humor?
When you think about it, it's weird that we have a physiological response to absurdity. We laugh at nonsense. We like it. We think it's funny.
Don't you think it's odd that we appreciate absurdity? Why would we develop that way? How does it benefit us?
HOBBES: I suppose if we couldn't laugh at the things that don't make sense, we couldn't react to a lot of life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Golda Meir
item.description: "Don't be so humble - you are not that great." -- Golda Meir

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Robert Conquest
item.description: "The behavior of any bureaucratic organization can best be understood by assuming that it is controlled by a secret cabal of its enemies." -- Robert Conquest

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Sean Kermes
item.description: "The dawn blushed; not because it was embarrassed (that doesn’t even make sense), but because light bends funny." -- Sean Kermes

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Zane
item.description: "This scene may disturb you, so you have to pay attention." -- Zane
